verses.verse: See,<WH2005> my eye<WH5869> has seen<WH7200> all<WH3605> this, my ear<WH241> has heard<WH8085> and understood<WH995> it.
What you know,<WH1847> the same do I know<WH3045> also:<WH1571> I am not inferior<WH5307> to you.
Surely<WH199> I would speak<WH1696> to the Almighty,<WH7706> and I desire<WH2654> to reason<WH3198> with God.<WH410>
But you are forgers<WH2950> of lies,<WH8267> you are all<WH3605> physicians<WH7495> of no<WH457> value.<WH457>
O that you would altogether hold<WH2790> your peace!<WH2790> and it should be your wisdom.<WH2451>
Hear<WH8085> now<WH4994> my reasoning,<WH8433> and listen<WH7181> to the pleadings<WH7379> of my lips.<WH8193>
Will you speak<WH1696> wickedly<WH5766> for God?<WH410> and talk<WH1696> deceitfully<WH7423> for him?
Will you accept<WH5375> his person?<WH6440> will you contend<WH7378> for God?<WH410>
Is it good<WH2896> that he should search<WH2713> you out? or as one man<WH582> mocks<WH2048> another, do you so mock<WH2048> him?
He will surely reprove<WH3198> you, if<WH518> you do secretly<WH5643> accept<WH5375> persons.<WH6440>
Shall not his excellency<WH7613> make you afraid?<WH1204> and his dread<WH6343> fall<WH5307> on you?
Your remembrances<WH2146> are like<WH4911> to ashes,<WH665> your bodies<WH1354> to bodies<WH1354> of clay.<WH2563>
Hold<WH2790> your peace,<WH2790> let me alone, that I may speak,<WH1696> and let come<WH5674> on me what<WH4100> will.
Why<WH5921> <WH4100> do I take<WH5375> my flesh<WH1320> in my teeth,<WH8127> and put<WH7760> my life<WH5315> in my hand?<WH3709>
Though he slay<WH6991> me, yet will I trust<WH3176> in him: but I will maintain<WH3198> my own ways<WH1870> before<WH413> <WH6440> him.
He also<WH1571> shall be my salvation:<WH3444> for an hypocrite<WH2611> shall not come<WH935> before<WH6440> him.
Hear<WH8085> diligently my speech,<WH4405> and my declaration<WH262> with your ears.<WH241>
Behold<WH2009> now,<WH4994> I have ordered<WH6186> my cause;<WH4941> I know<WH3045> that I shall be justified.<WH6663>
Who<WH4310> is he that will plead<WH7378> with me? for now,<WH6258> if<WH3588> I hold<WH2790> my tongue,<WH2790> I shall give<WH1478> up the ghost.<WH1478>
Only<WH389> do<WH6213> not two<WH8147> things to me: then<WH227> will I not hide<WH5641> myself from you.
Withdraw<WH7368> your hand<WH3709> far<WH7350> from me: and let not your dread<WH367> make me afraid.<WH1204>
Then call<WH7121> you, and I will answer:<WH6030> or<WH176> let me speak,<WH1696> and answer<WH7725> you me.
How<WH4100> many are my iniquities<WH5771> and sins?<WH2403> make me to know<WH3045> my transgression<WH6588> and my sin.<WH2403>
Why<WH4100> hide<WH5641> you your face,<WH6440> and hold<WH2803> me for your enemy?<WH341>
Will you break<WH6206> a leaf<WH5929> driven<WH5086> to and fro? and will you pursue<WH7291> the dry<WH3002> stubble?<WH7179>
For you write<WH3789> bitter<WH4846> things against<WH5921> me, and make me to possess<WH3423> the iniquities<WH5771> of my youth.<WH5271>
You put<WH7760> my feet<WH7272> also in the stocks,<WH5465> and look<WH8104> narrowly<WH8104> to all<WH3605> my paths;<WH734> you set a print<WH2707> on the heels<WH8328> of my feet.<WH7272>
And he, as a rotten<WH7538> thing, consumes,<WH1086> as a garment<WH899> that is moth<WH6211> eaten.<WH398>
